signals.summary: Scope 1 and scope 2 emissions increased, with a significant rise in supply chain (scope 3) emissions.

evidence.quote: Combined scope 1 and scope 2 (market-based) emissions were 3.1 million tCO2e, representing a 241% increase compared to 2019.

signals.summary: Scope 3 emissions increased by 25% compared to the previous year.

evidence.quote: Scope 3 (ambition-based) emissions were 8.4 million tCO2e, representing a 25% increase compared to 2019.

signals.summary: Scope 1 emissions decreased by only 8% year-on-year in 2024.

evidence.quote: Scope 1 emissions decreased by 8% year-on-year in 2024.

signals.summary: Progress in sourcing clean energy from within the same regions as data centers.

evidence.quote: In North America—a region that accounts for the majority of our electricity consumption—we made progress sourcing clean energy from within the same regions as our data centers, helping reduce our emissions.

signals.summary: Transition to primarily using LCAs for high-impact components in technical infrastructure.

evidence.quote: In 2024, we transitioned in to primarily using LCAs as we continue to increase the accuracy of our estimates.
